# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[Symbol("ym")] = map(x -> string(Dates.year(x), lpad(string(Dates.month(x)), 2, "0")), df[:dt])
    return df
end
```
This function takes a DataFrame and creates a new column named `ym`. This column is created by mapping over the DateTime column `dt` in the input DataFrame. For each element in that column (which are DateTimes), it extracts the year and month, concatenates them together into a string with format “yyyymm”, and stores this string in the new column `ym`. The function then returns the updated DataFrame.
